input_text:
Job Title: Maintenance Tech 12A - 2nd Shift

Location: Sumter, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
2nd Shift

Maintenance Technician 

Location: Sumter, SC

Shift: 2nd (3PM - 11PM)

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. 

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Summary

This position is primarily responsible for the lubrication, preventative maintenance, and repair of production machinery.

Duties And Responsibilities (included But Not Limited To)

Performs preventative maintenance assignments and duties as scheduled and/or required, reports findings to supervisor, and takes appropriate actions.Troubleshoot and repair electrical and mechanical malfunctions of machines and equipment.Perform diagnosis and repair of electric motor and control circuits.Perform disassemble and assemble electrical wires, connections, conduit, motors, controls, etc. on de-energized machinery/equipment and facility.Notify supervisor of recurring equipment malfunctions and corrective action taken, and of quality problems or supplies needed.Start machines and equipment to test operation following repair. May operate welding, fabricating, or machining equipment to repair or make replacement parts.Perform lubrication and oiling on machines including the change of hydraulic fluids and filters.Ensure that oil, water, and coolant spills are cleaned up, and waste materials are disposed of within Company and regulatory guidelines.Handle and disposes of coolants and oils within Company and regulatory guidelines.Responsible for maintaining a clean and safe environment including identification of unsafe conditions.May assist supervisor or engineering department to modify designs of machine components such as guarding, hydraulic, or mechanical drive systems. Perform continuous improvement (lean) activities as may be assigned or required.Perform other duties and assignments as scheduled and/or required.

Requirements/Qualifications

A high school diploma or the equivalent.Two (2) years of manufacturing experience.Basic understanding of CNC machine functions.Must be in good physical condition with an ability to stoop, bend, and lift up to fifty (50) pounds. Must be qualified in forklift operation. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing.

Additional Skills Desired

Basic understanding and ability to use MS Excel.Specialized training in mechanical or electrical repairs.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health.

SKF Celebrates Diversity in the Workplace. We strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Maintenance Supervisor

Location: Sumter, SC

Shift: 2nd (3PM - 11PM)

Job ID: 19208

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Maintenance Tech 12A - 2nd Shift
output_json.summary: Responsible for lubrication, preventative maintenance, and repair of production machinery.
job_responsibilities: Performs preventative maintenance assignments and duties as scheduled and/or required.
Troubleshoots and repairs electrical and mechanical malfunctions of machines and equipment.
Performs diagnosis and repair of electric motor and control circuits.
Operates welding, fabricating, or machining equipment to repair or make replacement parts.
Performs lubrication and oiling on machines including the change of hydraulic fluids and filters.
Ensures that oil, water, and coolant spills are cleaned up, and waste materials are disposed of within Company and regulatory guidelines.
Responsible for maintaining a clean and safe environment including identification of unsafe conditions.
May assist supervisor or engineering department to modify designs of machine components such as guarding, hydraulic, or mechanical drive systems.
Performs continuous improvement (lean) activities as may be assigned or required.
output_json.physical_requirements: Good physical condition with an ability to stoop, bend, and lift up to fifty (50) pounds. Must be qualified in forklift operation.
benefits: Generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.
Celebration of diversity in the workplace.

Best in class benefits including comprehensive healthcare options, company paid life insurance, STD, LTD, supplemental benefits like critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, and employee discount programs.

SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface. As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.
